nodes.description: LTTE自杀式袭击队突破路障并驾驶卡车冲撞寺庙附近的检查站
nodes.support_text: A LTTE Terrorist suicide squad crashed through roadblocks and set off a truck bomb outside a fabled Buddhist temple in central Kandy on Sunday, killing 11 people and wounding 23.

nodes.description: 卡车在距离佛教圣地Temple of the Tooth约30米处爆炸，造成11人死亡23人受伤
nodes.support_text: The truck exploded opposite the sacred Temple of the Tooth, mainly Buddhist Sri Lanka's holiest shrine which houses a sacred tooth of Lord Buddha. The tooth relic was safe.

nodes.description: 爆炸导致寺庙入口和屋顶受损，但主殿和供奉佛牙的圣物完好无损
nodes.support_text: The entrance and the roof of Dalada Maligawa were damaged in the blast, but the inner chamber was intact, it added.

nodes.description: 爆炸冲击波使800米外民宅窗户破裂，现场发现自杀式袭击者使用的卡车残骸
nodes.support_text: The blast shattered windows of houses as far as half a mile (800 metres) away, residents said.

nodes.description: 爆炸发生时间确定为2月3日6:10（UTC+5:30），早于原定2月4日的独立日庆典
nodes.support_text: The attack occurred days before the ancient capital is due to mark 50 years of independence in Sri Lanka on February 4 with celebrations to be attended by Britain's Prince Charles and other foreign dignitaries. Charles is scheduled to arrive in Sri Lanka on February 3.

nodes.description: 副国防部长承认存在安全漏洞，称难以防范隐藏的爆炸物
nodes.support_text: Deputy Defence Minister Anuruddha Ratwatte said. 'There was a serious security lapse, but it is nearly difficult to check when explosives are hidden'

edges.support_text: The suicide squad proceeded in a lorry along Raja Veediya (road) and had fired at the roadblocks. The lorry crashed through the gate and exploded in front of the Dalada Maligawa.
The entrance and the roof of Dalada Maligawa were damaged in the blast, but the inner chamber was intact, it added.
The blast shattered windows of houses as far as half a mile (800 metres) away, residents said.
Deputy Defence Minister Anuruddha Ratwatte said. 'There was a serious security lapse, but it is nearly difficult to check when explosives are hidden'

The attack occurred days before the ancient capital is due to mark 50 years of independence in Sri Lanka on February 4 with celebrations to be attended by Britain's Prince Charles and other foreign dignitaries. Charles is scheduled to arrive in Sri Lanka on February 3.
